website_summaries.verdict: Absolutely the best extension cord on the market.
pros: Long and heavy duty so it will handle anything you plug into it (heavy duty tools, etc.)
Lifetime warranty and LED lights reveal when power is going through cord
cons: Expensive and heavy, but you can get this cord in shorter, less expensive lengths

customer_reviews.title: Caught Fire Ruined Expensive Equipment!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic for a month just in time for it to run out of replacement warranty. The outlets caught fire today and melted the cord to my 250$ air compressor and the cord to my 189$ vacuum. Thankfully I was nearby and noticed the smoke and smell and was able to unplug the power source before anymore damage was done.
customer_reviews.author: Chris978

customer_reviews.title: Works with Chevy Volt charging station
customer_reviews.text: I need a 12 gauge heavy duty cord to use as an extension to charging a electric Chevy Volt car. So far its working fine. I checked where it gets warm during a charge. - Warm at the receptacle where it plugs into the wall socket. (not hot) - Warm where it connects to the Chevy volt charger. Again not hot just warm. - The cord itself is cool never even warm. So it appears some current loss only at the receptacle ends and not the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: A picture is worth a thousand words. I'm lucky it didn't start a fire. I do not recommend this extension cord
customer_reviews.author: conscientious consumer

customer_reviews.title: Updated Used outdoors for 3 months 24h a day
customer_reviews.text: Update 29-10-17 Used from May to October on my above ground pool pump, which runs 24/7 Still looking good. Now it will get winter usage. Very happy with this purchased. Update: bought it last year in July and still looks like new and works great. And we used it all the time outdoors. This extension is much heavier and thicker than the orange ones I had or any other extension cables I used it outside to connect to my above ground pool pump and ionizer and it was on 24 hours a day for 3 months. Very happy, heavy duty extension lead a must have in your home
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Scary Cordes
customer_reviews.text: I needed some additional extension cords for the shop. These cords had extremely high reviews, so I ignored to 1 star and bought two. Yikes! Every thing I plug into these cords, actually spark when being plugged in! Several tools are very sensitive and this sparking is risking serious damage, so I have discontinued using them. I good friend, who is an electrical engineer, said he knew how to fix the issue, so we will see. If they can't be "fixed" then in the trash they go! Just what everyone wants. . . buy expensive extension cords just so an electrical engineer can "fix" them.
customer_reviews.author: Binford Man

customer_reviews.title: Warning? Did I get a lemon? Do not use on a 1500 watt heater.
customer_reviews.text: So this does not seem like it should be. check the cord on the heater and realized that it looks like it is getting fairly warm. The two cords were actually hard to pull apart. I'm not sure if this is normal or if I just got a lemon. The heater that was plugged in is 1500 w. Seems like it was a bit too much for it, the other end of the cord looked fine.
customer_reviews.author: S Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Going On/Off
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first but now no. I brought it inside and plugged it in an outlet I knew worked properly and it only worked if I held it in a certain manner but if the cord moved it clicked off. Now it goes on and off so fast I’m not even sure I can use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to power an RV studio. I use lights, run a radio, a fridge and freezer, and occasionally a small fan. I also use the central heating. The furnace burns propane, but the fan is obviously drawing power. I don't use the AC. So far this cord is handling the load. It's both a thicker gauge and higher capacity than anything I found locally in stores. The glowing ends are handy. It's been in service for about 2 weeks, and after I stop running the heat the load lightens considerably. I'll post an update at some point, but I'm really happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn N. Empire

customer_reviews.title: Completely Useless
customer_reviews.text: Three prongs doesn't fit into standard outlets. I waited too long to send this back. It is totally useless to me. The third prong doesn't fit into standard outlets. It is completely useless to me. DO NOT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a very flexible 12/3 25 foot extension cord.  This isn’t it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been spoiled by my Bosch 12/3 extension cord that came with one of my Bosch tools. It is absolutely flexible, lays flat, the outer cover is extremely flexible. I just bought 2 different 25 foot extension cords that claim to be flexible hoping for something similar. This Iron Forge extension cord is fairly stiff. It doesn’t lay flat. It seems like a good cord, well made, but it is more like a standard vinyl extension cord, not the supple, floppy, cord I’d hoped for. If you want a standard well made cord, this one is good. If you are looking for one as perfectly supple as the Bosch, this isn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: David Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality to give you 100 feet of real power
customer_reviews.text: Not many products have solid five star rating and this one does. Those ratings are correct for it is worth the money. When you go to 100 feet power drops unless your electric cable is thick enough and this one is. I added a thinner extension cord to reach the very edge of my yard and my electric weed whip/edge trimmer stopped because the thinner extension cord could not carry the power. This one does and is made for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Burkhard A. Meier

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, flexible. Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace a cord I had borrowed from a friend. Nearly considered keeping this one for myself. Cable is heavy, well insulated, and still flexible (I've had other, less expensive cables that would retain their original shape). On a side not, I was at a local big box store, and saw a cable similar to this one - For $25 more than I paid. This is a great value, and I'll likely buy another soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C

customer_reviews.title: Tested it as recommended and then put it to work
customer_reviews.text: Came promptly and as described. Bought it to connect to trough heaters. Tested it as recommended and then put it to work. Has been in operation for about a week with two cords attached. Working great and feel safer using it in the barn with the equipment being used during the inclement weather we are currently experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: sudie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for high load workshop stationary power tools
customer_reviews.text: This 12 gauge wire extension cord at 25 feet was perfect for my workshop to power 110 V stationary power tools - dust collector, shaper, bandsaw and grinder. Check the power requirements and length of extension cord/wire gauge in your power tool's manual so you do not damage your motor or continuously trip your circuit breaker. Previous 14 gauge wire extension cords could not handle the start up of the dust collector or shaper. The lighted plug connectors are a plus feature because it alerts me that I still have the extension cord plugged into the wall when I clean up and leave the shop. Highly recommended as a shop stationary power tool extension cord in 12 gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Jim & Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good price and well made
customer_reviews.text: I cut the female end and use another 4 wire plug to hook my 120v generator outlet to a power inlet. It does get stiff when cold. The inside wires are copper, not aluminum
customer_reviews.author: PeterC

customer_reviews.title: In good shape after 3 years outside.
customer_reviews.text: Good value. it seems very heavy duty and the plug and receptacle are solid. the female end is lighted indicating power - a nice feature. Time will tell how it holds up in the sun and rain, but for now - A+! Update after three years. The cord has been outdoors 365 on a floating dock powering lights and receptacles for three New England years. Sun and rain and freezing and saltwater. It’s still going strong and looking good. No cracks or damage. Bit of fading is all. Not bad. Ordered another. Very satisfied. Still a strong 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: smithcover

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.  Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous. I used this for 6 hours to run an LED outdoor light and it burned up. Triggered my breakers and set a fire. Thankfully it was outdoors and was taken care of quickly but was not something I would care to repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Works well with EV
customer_reviews.text: The cord works great. I use it to charge my EV (Chevy Volt) when the outlet is just out of reach and it works great. The old cord I used use to heat up a little ore than I was comfortable with, but this one doesn't give off any heat at all. So worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: One can't say much about an extension cord -- it's three pieces of wire going from point A to point B, with a plug on one end and a socket on the other. This is a good one, though -- it's 12-gauge wire, so it can handle the full 15 amps that you can pull from a wall socket. (It's the same wire gauge as most house wiring.) The socket lights up when the cord is plugged in -- that can be handy in the dark or when the outlet it's plugged into is controlled by a switch. It can handle being outdoors. The jacket is bright yellow, so it won't get lost in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Savitzky

customer_reviews.title: What every household should use for electrical power equipment outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this extension cord for my new electric lawnmower. Amazon has recommended a 16 ga extension cord but it flat out isn't suited for outdoor equipment. This extension cord has lights on either end that show you have power. The jacket is thick but flexible and being 12 ga. gives the user a hefty cushion for when they might be pulling serious amps running multiple power tools. I operated my mower (15A) for 30 mins. continuously and it didn't even get a little warm.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was a good purchase for a week.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was a good purchase but, it went bad in a week. I did not contact the company. I had already through the packing away. Keep your packing if, you purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron L.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, works well
customer_reviews.text: First thing you should know is that this cord weighs a ton because it's a heavier duty cable. So, when you get it, unwind it and lay it out in the sun. It will warm up and be much easier to handle. The lighted ends are nice. That way you won't make yourself crazy wondering why the item you've plugged in isn't working. If the cord isn't lit then you know it's the wall plug that's the problem and not the item you've plugged into the cord.
customer_reviews.author: ML-L

customer_reviews.title: Quality Cord/Responsive Company
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be a quality cord and as described online. It is heavy, but not overly so, and appears to have some flexibility to it. have only tested it out to ensure it works with my leaf blower. I have not yet put it to routine use and won't until Spring. I bought this 100 ft cord to use with my new leaf blower so I could clean my gutters without getting on a ladder anymore. The company that sold it to me has sent me several emails to see how I liked it so I thought I would post this review. It also came well packaged for a heavy item, and the box arrived in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Decent cord for the price, wire is thick enough, not thrilled with the plugs on each end
customer_reviews.text: Basically the same review I left for the same brand 10gage ext cable I purchased. The thickness is fine and the weather resistance is fine but I'm just not happy with the ends they put on the cord. The male end on this one stays decently into an outlet but it's still "a little loose". I''ll probably wind up cutting both ends off on this one as well and putting on my own 15A ends.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Safe outdoor power source!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 100' heavy-duty extension cord to use outside, it circles one side of my house up to the front porch. The cord's ends are lighted when it is plugged into electric power! That part I really like, to assure that the cord is electrified. Making using them super safe! Our house is OLD has very few electrical outlets, and no power outlet outside. This provides an opportunity for a safe power source outside, when needed. Will be useful during Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: C. Atchison

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty cord. Nice lighted end
customer_reviews.text: I got this extension cord to use when charging my Tesla from 110v source if I’m on the road and need to. Normally you wouldn’t want to use an extension cord but this one is heavy enough to not be an issue. At home I charge on 240v so this is really just for use in a pinch where 240v isn’t available. I like the lighted end so I can see that it has power.
customer_reviews.author: RKB in Washington

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Extension Cord seems rugged and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 25' heavy duty extension cord to run a compressor and to use with a 50' version to run an electric lawn mower. Both cords seem well made with good materials. Time will tell ... but I believe these are quality cords that will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T.

customer_reviews.title: Older lady very happy
customer_reviews.text: I am 73 and cutting up down trees for firewood. Electric chain saw. Running it on 12 guage cord give the most power and helps me. I was afraid the weight of the cord and stiffness was going to be a pain. Yes it’s heavier than a regular outdoor extension. But we’ll worth it. No it’s not that stiff to be a problem. Very happy with it so far. Love the yellow because it stands out in the bushes and the trees. Love the lighted plug
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S.

customer_reviews.title: Great to make use of that dryer plug in the garage
customer_reviews.text: I had a high draw 110 saw that kept tripping my breaker on the 110 circuit. I bought this and now use the dryer plug for my saw, drill press, and compressor as needed. No issues with tripping the breaker either on the cord or at the panel. Aan, I didn't have to call an electrician to run a new circuit for the garage. I wish I had this years ago. Gives me a lot of peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: LompocTom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. High Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality extension cord. I also appreciate the Velcro straps that came with it for storing it neatly. I use two of these combined with Quick 220 to charge my Tesla Model S when on the road. Perfect for that application.
customer_reviews.author: AKBNJ

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to carry a full 15AMPS for my small, light duty welder. This cord is heavy enough that it doesn't overheat during short runs of welding bead and it delivers the full amperage. The length is enough for me to move it around my garage and get to most projects. it has lights on the end to tell you it's working and the bright yellow color helps prevent trip hazards. Worked as expected and was delivered promptly for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my welder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep on my little welding cart for my amaller MIG welder. It works great! Nice and heavy duty. Wish i would have got a longer one. 25ft sounded longer in my head. The lighted ends are great for tools and welding. You can tell right away if you blew a fuse or soemthing if the light is off. But if your tool wont work but the cord is still lit, then you know it's the tool. Very happy. Will have to get the next size up soon though
customer_reviews.author: Aaron P.

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable, possible fire Hazzard
customer_reviews.text: The 3 Plug head started malfunctioning after 5 days of constant use. I had to buy another one. I'm very dissapointed on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bubble House

customer_reviews.title: The ground prong is loosely made
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the fact that the ground prong is much loose than the hot and neutral prongs. After careful examination, the ground prong does not have enough white plastic surrounded it. In comparison, I have a 10 gauge 20 amp Yellow Jacket extension cord, and all the three prongs are much more robust than the ones from this cord.
customer_reviews.author: passion0217

customer_reviews.title: Charges a plug-in hybrid without getting warm!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to allow me to charge my plug-in hybrid in the driveway and at locations where an extension cord is needed. Works perfectly! The cord I had was a smaller gauge and would get frighteningly hot after 20 mins or so, this one doesn't get warm at all! Handles the amperage with stride!
customer_reviews.author: Samiam098

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality.
customer_reviews.text: High quality breaker. This is the 3rd GFCI I've bought and this the best one. It has led lights, easy to test, no bulky/cheap buttons to push like others. Cable is flexible. I am really satisfied with this.
customer_reviews.author: R I

customer_reviews.title: Proper wire gauge for appliances. Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice heavy duty cord. Bought for my sister to use on her washing machine. I make these cords myself from 10/3 cable if longer than 25ft. Be smart and use at least 12ga extension cords on appliances! Nice lighted end so you know the AC voltage is present, this is a nice feature so you know what's up when plugging in. This product is well made and should last a very long time - would be great for a generator too (it is the proper gauge for it's length) Recommended at the quality and price point.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Pongratz

customer_reviews.title: so good! Very well made cord
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my electric car. Yeah, yeah, yeah, I know you aren't supposed to use extension cords with electric car chargers but hey - I'm not always near an outlet when I'm on the road! So far, so good! Very well made cord!
customer_reviews.author: CrzyShane

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly for High Power Job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cord to use with a Butterball XXL Electric Fryer. The cord, being heavy duty, worked perfectly. The fryer was able to reach max temps with no problems or heat in the cord at all. I used the fryer for 4 - 7 lb Turkey Breasts and a large pork butt, used to make Carnitas. Frying was done one after another and for a total of 5 continuous hours. Again no issues with the cord or power at the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great cord for EV charging
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my level 1 EVSE for my BMW i3. OEM doesn't suggest to use extension cord, but forums all said that an extension cord of serious gauge would be fine. This is very heavy, serious gauge - I'd say the 14 gauge would actually be fine as my EVSE seems to be 14 not 12. Either way, great use for EV charging with level 1 EVSE.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Krease

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to power and old plugin lawnmower, wood chipper and weed wacker. The cord in soft and well made. At 100 ft it is noticeably heavy but not out of line for the size. Easily coiled back after use. Make sure you do this after every use and plug the two ends together. store in a cool try place away from the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Novak

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to have an extension cord to keep in my Tesla just in case of an emergency charge being needed. Fits the bill perfectly and is rated for the proper amps. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: ipad user

customer_reviews.title: It’s heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. I found they had taken a set due to the way they’d been tightly coiled. I keep trying to unbend them. They aren’t as flexible as I’d hoped for. I wish I only bought one to check it out before buying the 2nd one. In the spring I’ll probably shops for a 20 footer in a brick and mortar store so I can determine whether it’s super flexible before shelling out my money. I will continue to use these as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mystic Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Good, strong, high quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to plug in inside for my battery and surge protector combo, I wanted an extension cord that I could trust to stand the strain. This has only a single three-prong female unit at the end but that was all I needed, I can finally trust my extension cord with multiple devices plugged into the protector.
customer_reviews.author: Milford

customer_reviews.title: Use it indoors too!
customer_reviews.text: The standard cheap indoor extension cords are much to light duty, usually 16 gauge wire. Ok for powering a table or desk lamp but sometimes that's pushing the limits. This SJTW heavy duty outdoor extension cord is perfect for indoor uses requiring a higher current flow, such as even the smallest of room space heaters, high powered sound equipment, freezers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for an electric patio heater and it fits the bill. We did need an extension cord so where the two meet we covered the connection with plastic to protect form the elements. It works perfectly - wish it was black or green or any other color that wasn’t so bright but otherwise - good product!
customer_reviews.author: Hane

customer_reviews.title: Great GFI 3 outlet wire. I had it outside with a 100 feet from the same brand
customer_reviews.text: The gfi I had kept burning my extension cords. This one worked great very happy and it has 3 outlets, 👌
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Charging electric vehicle
customer_reviews.text: I am using this cord to charge my electric vehicle. I live in a second floor condo and needed an additional 20 foot of cord. It has worked great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rbow13

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I needed van extension cord that could safely be used with an electrically powered oil radiator room heater. This extension is heavy duty enough to handle the job with a extra margin of safety. The extension cord remains cool to the touch even with the 1500w heater on high. Here are the specs for the heater: PELONIS Electric, 1500W Portable Oil-Filled Radiator Space Heater with Programmable Thermostat, Remote Control, and 10-Hour Timer for Home&Office, NY1507-14A, Black, 25.59" H x 9.84" D x 14.5" W
customer_reviews.author: WFS

customer_reviews.title: excellent heavy duty cord
customer_reviews.text: Nice product in every way. Flexible, sturdy, comes with a handy velcro hanger which can go over a nail. Male and female plugs at both ends look to be very sturdy. The female plug lights up when the cord is plugged in to show that you have current. At 25 feet, it fits the bill nicely when I don't want to unroll at 50 or 100 foot cord. So far, I've used it several times with a palm sander but I bought it primarily to use with my SunJoe pressure washer which recommends that an extension cord not be longer than 25 feet and be at least 14G. This one is 12G. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Professorie

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am using mine for a small refrigerator that I call the snack fridge and another for a small chest freezer I call the snack freezer. They have worked like a charm so far. I am really getting very good use from them. I have 3 of these and I do think they are a great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: allsmiles277

customer_reviews.title: TIME MACHINE APPROVED!!!
customer_reviews.text: After careful inspection, I was able to determine the quality of the diode bond in correlation with symmetrical inheritance of opposing teraplasmic induction the helical formation of corresponding triptophene structures were uniform in density and conductive continuity. Overall, balls...
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Used for 220 V Single Phase
customer_reviews.text: I have used this cable to connect 4 different pieces of woodworking equipment to 220 Volt single phase power. It works very well for that and is much less expensive than buying other cords. Accessing the 3 copper cables (White, Black and Green) within the cord is very easy with a simple knife.
customer_reviews.author: CMM

customer_reviews.title: This is one serious extension cord
customer_reviews.text: 100ft is a bit unwieldy - at this gauge, it makes this cord just too bulky and heavy for spooling. But that is a small price to pay for the quality this cord delivers. It's built to withstand just about anything you can throw at it, so you would have to try really hard to inflict damage on it. A nice touch is the lighted end receptor - it gives off a nice little glow showing it's live, a handy feature when you're trying to determine if what you have plugged in is working or if it's the cord. This is a really good extension cord - an excellent investment.
customer_reviews.author: J Michael Tibor

customer_reviews.title: really REALLY thick
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if you don't have room to store it. It's flexible but thick and heavy. Now my portable table saw makes the lights dim in other rooms, and it didn't do that with the regular orange store cords. (that's a good thing: it means the saw can get more current)
customer_reviews.author: S. EckertTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: USA flags on item are misleading
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and actually paid more for this over other items because of the USA flag on the front, I should have read closer as it may be designed in the USA but it is your standard made in China extension cord you can get at any big box home store, only this one costs more.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Melted and burnt under 13 amp load
customer_reviews.text: Unsure why I had such a different experience from the majority of reviewers, but I purchases this along with 2 other 12 gauge cords about a month ago. They've all been under constant 13 amp loads in a 115F room since then. The others are showing light wear, but this one has significantly melted and blackened around the hot male prong.
customer_reviews.author: Waysie Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Works great for lawn mower.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same one 3 years ago and it’s worked great until I ran it over with my electric lawnmower. Ordered the exact same one right away. Got it and used it today to mow my yard. It’s better, and lighter than the original. I’m thrilled. Thank you! Way better than the $109 75lb one from Home Depot! :)
customer_reviews.author: Alid

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Finally an extension cord made to last. It sits outside all winter for my block heater and gets run over pretty regularly. Holding up excellent and hasnt come close to disappointing me. The light/glowing on the plug end is an awesome touch too - I can look out my window in the morning and see that the timer successfully turned on my block heater & know that I can count on climbing into a warm truck.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Werthman

customer_reviews.title: Good extension cord....
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this cord to supply power to our RV camper and it has been great. I’ve even been able to start the AC in the camper without tripping any breakers. The cord looks and feels very sturdy. Appreciate the light in the cord to show that it’s connected to power although it’s difficult to see in bright daylight.
customer_reviews.author: Tedma01

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty extension cord
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heavy duty extension cord to connect my small generator to my portable ac unit as backup in the event of a power failure. The cord is heavy duty and looks pretty good to me though I’m no expert on electrical cords. Anyhow it worked well when I hooked it up on a test run.
customer_reviews.author: abh

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice quality though
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how heavy it would be. I haven't used it yet, as I am trying to decide whether to keep the 100 foot long or go back for a 50 footer. This thing weighs about the same as a second grader. It is a very nice quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Sue W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Electric Cords
customer_reviews.text: I have order several cords sold by Iron Cords company. This one is of the same quality as all the ones I purchased over the last few years. I even went back through my orders on Amazon to make sure I was ordering from the same vendor. Great extension cords and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: J Mark Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best Value I Could Find
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deal I could find for this length and gauge. It was about double the price at Home Depot. Cord is sturdy and I didn't notice the yellow coming off. It's a bit stiff, but being such a thick gauge I think that is unavoidable.
customer_reviews.author: Dumac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cord!
customer_reviews.text: I am very surprised with the quality of this cord. Most cords in this price bracket have really bad insulation. These are as good as more expensive brands I have. They are not the typical stiff and hard to roll up cords. On par with my Ridgid brand cords at half the price. Like them so much that I ordered another!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Electricity goes in one end, comes out the other
customer_reviews.text: Using this cord for some pretty heavy duty outdoor projects, and it works quite well. the casing holds up well to abrasion, it stays pretty flexible in sub-zero temperatures, the bright yellow color makes it easy to find, and the price was good. Shipping was fast, and it arrived as scheduled.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Fury

customer_reviews.title: A lot of wire, but built for 110 volts
customer_reviews.text: We needed this for a 220 volt motor and the plugs are for 110, so you have to buy separate male and female plugs to make the #10 wire do the work. But it's a nice piece of wire for a bargain price, flexible, and easy to manipulate. Replacing the plugs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like the light in the female end of the cord ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so heavy duty, it definitely lives up to expectations. I live in WI and the only issue I have found is in the winter it does not straighten out well. This can be said for all cords, but since it is extra heavy duty it is less bendable. I really like the light in the female end of the cord too.
customer_reviews.author: WagsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works, but ends do not illuminate
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars because the cord I received does not light up, on either end. It works, but that was one of the main reasons for which I purchased this specific cord.
customer_reviews.author: CPS

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: I have used this quite a bit in my yard and it is flexible, and not too heavy to drag around when using with an electric edger, leaf blower, or hedge trimmer. I can also use this to power a compound miter saw, or any other tool, without worrying about it getting to hot or shorting out because I am pulling too many amps.
customer_reviews.author: Sports Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good value at good pride
customer_reviews.text: This cord is very good for several uses where you need high voltage protection. I used it as a temporary time for a Soda fridge and it did a great job for the time period that I used it. I recommend it. And the lighted end was an added bonus so I could ensure that it was powered
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great option for garage appliances
customer_reviews.text: I needed to re-arrange our garage. I moved the fridge and freezer to a corner where I would need extension cords to the nearest outlet. These have worked great. They do not run hot. I read all of the requirements on both appliances very carefully before I made this purchase. It's not a temporary solution but is working for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for my Dad
customer_reviews.text: My dad had 4 or 5 extension cords that were all orange, 16 gauge, and of varying lengths. I purchased this and 2 other of different colored cables so anyone at a glance could see which one was the length they needed and know it was heavy enough to run almost anything.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Great option and fix for minimal need
customer_reviews.text: Great to find a shorter heavy duty cord that works great and is safe for items such as heaters with more voltage. I got tired of using longer cords for the short distance needed and then having electrical cord everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Leamon

customer_reviews.title: Quality Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality extension cord, and the price was better here than locally. A couple of tips: 1) To keep it from twisting and tangling, do an online search for "roadie wrap", and watch a video to learn the proper way to coil and extension cord. 2) After you coil it properly, using the "roadie wrap" technique, wrap a bungee cord around it, and hang it from the bungee cord hooks. This is a pretty thick cord, so using a bungee cord enables you to hang it up without buying some sort of cord hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality!
customer_reviews.text: Best extension cord I bought. I got two because I needed a long reach in my farm. Awesome. We had pick up trucks, vans and cars drive over the cables and is still like new. I forgot to bring one back and it stay out under the sun (summer) for a week , still like new. Will be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty 120v 15amp Drop Cord Single Plug In & Lighted.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty drop cord! Large diameter wire for good amperage draw. 12/3. 15 amps. Says: Veteran Business Designed in USA (but nothing about Made in the USA)???? I guess some is better than none
customer_reviews.author: SpikeO

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the right cord!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd spend this much on an extension cord but the lawn mower called for this amperage. Don't burn up a $150 item trying to be cheap with an underrated cord. If you have a problem with weight, it's pretty heavy, once you have it out of the box and unwrapped it's easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Just received--charging Nissan Leaf
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to charge our nissan leaf (trickle charge) overnight from an outdoor outlet. It worked well. I can't speak to how well it will last yet since we just got it, but it's good enough to handle the load of charging the car.
customer_reviews.author: Delayed Gratification

customer_reviews.title: It looks heavy duty and not expensive.
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I wanted, but as I haven't put it to the test yet, (supplies for hurricane season/ generator), I can't speak as to it's ability to do it's job. I will say, it seems heavy duty. Does not look cheap, and I like the updated lit plug. Always handy to let me know I have electric running through the line. That is all I can say about it for now, other than it was not expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Build very strong for heavy duty use
customer_reviews.text: Looking at it it's exactly what I was looking for. I tested with a 15 amps load and it worked as I expected. Appears well made and heavy duty. Will really test it the next time we have another power outage.
customer_reviews.author: 1greywolf

customer_reviews.title: Best Outdoor Extension Cord!
customer_reviews.text: Met and exceeded all my needs and expectation! Job well done for developing and selling the superb product. So far I have used only for a few months, but the apparent construction of the product seemed so assuring for a long life of trouble free service.
customer_reviews.author: Byung m. Na

customer_reviews.title: Came in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought a new electric snowblower. Our cable was a little short for the driveway... This extension cord gave him the length he needed. And it came in a timely manner, which we appreciated very much.
customer_reviews.author: P. G. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great and Soft Outdoor Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 50-foot version of this product and used for about 2 months. We've used it to power speakers, use outdoor tools (rotary, drill, leaf blower), and charge our phone outside because, hey, who wants to go inside to charge something when you're enjoying the great outdoors?. Cable is thicker and heavier than a normal 16/3 extension cord, but still very pliable and soft to reach around building corners without kinking. The lighted plug is a perfect safety feature to have as well. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Danio

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord is perfect for charging my lithium golf cart battery 🔋. My older 14 gauge extension cord would get hot. My new 12 gauge cord is more durable and less chance for failure or overheating . It is also nice to be able to see the ends do to lighting up
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Flexible extension chord
customer_reviews.text: For the gage, this was quite flexible. I cannot comment on durability as I have only had it for a few days. The light at the ends were very helpful as the fuse tripped and I knew electricity was not flowing. Overall, seems like a solid product and expect years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Gurug

customer_reviews.title: Feels heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: It feels heavy duty and well made. The three plug in outlet is added convenient whe you needed to be protected with three tools from getting electric shock or worse. Competitive when it come to price.
customer_reviews.author: Paling

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks ago I bought two of these at $14 each; then lately I've seen they've gone up to $17, but to get two of the exact cords for just $20 was just the bomb. I love these cords, and they seem to not mind Michigan's cold weather at all.
customer_reviews.author: bignutjam

customer_reviews.title: This is a beefy extension cord
customer_reviews.text: For the money I don't think you'll find a more capable cord. It's not the easiest to deal with and it will not "coil" super easily but if you need the heavier gauge, buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stee

customer_reviews.title: Well-made
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdiness of this extension cord. It is not a flimsy lightweight cord. It is obviously well-made and I really like the lighted end. Good product and good service. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: William Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Power Cords!
customer_reviews.text: Really big fan of these cords...well made, and have gotten to appreciate the plug end being lit when plugged in! No more looking for a cord that is ready to use. Great quality...may buy a few more!
customer_reviews.author: LFGEnergy

customer_reviews.title: Product lives up to it's Heavy duty label
customer_reviews.text: The cord is substantial, not filmsey. Has a very firm feel. From the appearance and feel of the product I am looking forward to long life and durability from this extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Loring

customer_reviews.title: Durable Extension Cord. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: After doing a good bit of research online, I finally broke down and spent the money on this cord. I have a plug-in electric lawnmower and most of my yard tools are electric. My previous cord had started to disintegrate to the point where it was dangerous to use. This cord is very thick, but still manageable. I would recommend unrolling it and laying it in the sun for a day to soften up the casing. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Myers

customer_reviews.title: Heavy guage wire is just what I wanted for blow drying wet dogs.
customer_reviews.text: It's not advised to run a 15 amp hair dryer on anything but a wall socket. But I have to chase my young pit bulls around the bathroom sometimes. This cord should be safe IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Finger

customer_reviews.title: good quality heavy duty extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Other than the weight of this 100' cord, which is what I expected, this extension cord has been holding up its end of the bargain. I will weigh in again after more use to report on the durability of this product. Right now, I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, price, and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: So far, this appears to be a nicely constructed HD extension cord. I needed a heavier 12/3 version for larger current draw while being used for a block heater in colder weather. It is working fine. I also like the lighted end which shows it’s working.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Goose

customer_reviews.title: The perfect anniversary gift
customer_reviews.text: Best extension cord I've ever owned. I use the heck out of these things for DIY and Christmas lights and this is the best one I've ever had. It's got a great feel to it, it curls softly and it's a great color. The light up tips are even exactly bight enough. Looks like I found my wife's anniversary gift! Lucky gal.
customer_reviews.author: Creighton Yost

customer_reviews.title: 15 amps no problem
customer_reviews.text: Works without any problems, handles 15 amp no problems plug does not get hot. Only the female plug lights not both. Could be difficult to handle (stiff) in cold weather .
customer_reviews.author: L.I. Mom

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try it out before I reviewed, obviously. So far I love it. Extremely sturdy and I love the light that tells me it's working when it's plugged in to the car!! I'm thinking now that I should have gotten the 50 ft. Perhaps I'll order that one also.xtremely
customer_reviews.author: Jilly VonDee

customer_reviews.title: Bought this on accident but decided to keep it
customer_reviews.text: I actually needed a bigger extension cord for my equipment but I ended up keeping this instead of returning it. It works well for smaller equipment and it’s the perfect length for what I need. I’ve never had any problems with it getting hot like I’ve had with other cords.
customer_reviews.author: Tarah

product_meta.title: 100 Foot Outdoor Extension Cord - 12/3 SJTW Heavy Duty Yellow 3 Prong Extension Cable - Great for Garden and Major Appliances (100 Foot - Yellow)
feature_bullets: ALL PURPOSE EXTENSION CORD for Indoor and Outdoor use. Great for gardening, landscaping, or powering
WATER RESISTANT: Flexible vinyl covering protects cords against moisture, abrasion and sunlight.
REINFORCED BLADES protect prongs from bending or breaking. 12 GAUGE HEAVY DUTY wire, 100 foot, 15 amp, 125 volt, 1875 watt, 5-15P/R, ULListed
LED LIGHTED SOCKET - The female end of the cord lights up to indicate when the power is on. SLIP RESISTANT DESIGN.
LIFETIME REPLACEMENT WARRANTY – Iron Forge Cable stands behind all of its products 100%. If anything ever goes wrong with this, we will replace it with a new item.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,822 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
